intro: Chrysiphiala latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaf chrysiphiala, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
